org.opensocial.models
Class Model

java.lang.Object
  java.util.AbstractMap<K,V>
      java.util.HashMap
          org.json.simple.JSONObject
              org.opensocial.models.Model
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Cloneable, java.util.Map, org.json.simple.JSONAware, org.json.simple.JSONStreamAware
Direct Known Subclasses:
Activity, Album, AppData, Comment, Group, MediaItem, Notification, Person, StatusMood
public class Model
extends org.json.simple.JSONObject

Generic OpenSocial model class. Every OpenSocial resource class, whether it models concrete (e.g. person) or abstract (e.g. AppData) concepts, extends this class. Instance methods provide an interface for getting and setting arbitrary properties (fields) of these resources.

Author:
Jason Cooper
See Also:
Serialized Form

getFieldNames

public java.lang.String[] getFieldNames()

hasField

public boolean hasField(java.lang.String fieldName)
Returns true if a value is associated with the specified field name, false otherwise.

Parameters:
fieldName - name of field to look up

getField

public java.lang.Object getField(java.lang.String fieldName)
Returns the value of the specified field as an Object.

Parameters:
fieldName - name of field whose value is to be returned

getFieldAsMap

public java.util.Map getFieldAsMap(java.lang.String fieldName)
Returns the value of the specified field as a Map. Equivalent to (Map) getField(fieldName), hence this method will throw a ClassCastException if the field does not implement Map.

Parameters:
fieldName - name of field whose value is to be returned
See Also:
ClassCastException

getFieldAsList

public java.util.List getFieldAsList(java.lang.String fieldName)
Returns the value of the specified field as a List. Equivalent to (List) getField(fieldName), hence this method will throw a ClassCastException if the field does not implement List.

Parameters:
fieldName - name of field whose value is to be returned
See Also:
ClassCastException

getFieldAsString

public java.lang.String getFieldAsString(java.lang.String fieldName)
Returns the value of the specified field as a String. Equivalent to (String) getField(fieldName), hence this method will throw a ClassCastException if the field is not of type String.

Parameters:
fieldName - name of field whose value is to be returned
See Also:
ClassCastException

addTemplateParameter

                                    java.lang.String value)
